refnamediv.refpurpose: The physical properties of the spacecraft

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The Spacecraft ballistic and mass properties include the drag and SRP areas and coefficients as well as the spacecraft dry mass. These quantities are used primarily in orbital dynamics modelling.

entry.para: The time system and format of the Epoch field. In the GUI, this field is called Epoch Format.

listitem.para: A1ModJulian, TAIModJulian, UTCModJulian, TTModJulian, TDBModJulian, A1Gregorian, TAIGregorian, TTGregorian, UTCGregorian, TDBGregorian

entry.para: The ModelFile field allows you to upload spacecraft models that are either in 3DS or POV format.
The orbital argument of periapsis expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<AOP<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The orbital velocity azimuth expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<AZI<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The coefficent of drag used to compute the acceleration due to drag.
The coefficent of reflectivity used to compute the acceleration due toSRP.
Component (1,1) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM11 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (1,2) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM12 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (1,3) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM13 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (2,1) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM21 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Description
Component (2,3) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM23 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (3,1) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM31 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (3,2) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM32 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
Component (3,3) of the Direction Cosine Matrix. DCM33 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The declination of the orbital position expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The declination of orbital velocity expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The area used to compute acceleration due to atmospheric drag.
The dry mass of the spacecraft, which does not include fuel mass.
The orbital eccentricity expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: ECC < 0.9999999 or ECC > 1.0000001. If ECC > 1, SMA must be < 0

entry.para: A measure of the orbital eccentricity and argument of periapsis. EquinoctialH and EquinoctialK together govern how eliiptic an orbit is and where the periapsis is located. EquinotialH = ECC * sin(AOP)

A measure of the orbital eccentricity and argument of periapsis. EquinoctialH and EquinoctialK together govern how elliptic an orbit is and where the periapsis is located. EquinotialK = ECC * cos(AOP)
A measure of the orientation of the orbit. EquinoctialP and EquinoctialQ together govern how an orbit is oriented. EquinotialP = tan(INC/2)*sin(RAAN).
A measure of the orientation of the orbit. EquinoctialP and EquinoctialQ together govern how an orbit is oriented. EquinotialQ = tan(INC/2)*cos(RAAN).
The value of the first Euler angle. EulerAngle1 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the second Euler angle. EulerAngle2 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the third Euler angle. EulerAngle3 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the first Euler angle rate. EulerAngleRate1 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the second Euler angle rate. EulerAngleRate2 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the third Euler angle rate. EulerAngleRate3 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The orbital flight path angle expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The orbital inclination expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
A measure of the location of the spacecraft in it's orbit. MLONG = AOP + RAAN + MA.
The ModelOffsetX field lets you translate Spacecraft in +X or -X axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelOffsetY field lets you translate Spacecraft in +Y or -Y axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelOffsetZ field lets you translate Spacecraft in +Z or -Z axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelRotationX field lets you do a fixed rotation of spacecraft's attitude w.r.t X-axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelRotationY field lets you do a fixed rotation of spacecraft's attitude w.r.t Y-axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelRotationZ field lets you do a fixed rotation of spacecraft's attitude w.r.t Z-axis of central body's coordinate system.
The ModelScale field lets you apply a scale factor to the spacecraft model's size.
The ModelFile field allows you to upload any spacecraft model that is in 3DS or POV model format.

"First component of quaternion. GMATs quaternion representation includes the three vector components as the first three elements in the quaternion and the rotation component as the last element in the quaternion. Q1 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner."

Second component of quaternion. GMATs quaternion representation includes the three vector components as the first three elements in the quaternion and the rotation component as the last element in the quaternion. Q2 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.

Third component of quaternion. GMATs quaternion representation includes the three vector components as the first three elements in the quaternion and the rotation component as the last element in the quaternion. Q3 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.

Fourth component of quaternion. GMATs quaternion representation includes the three vector components as the first three elements in the quaternion and the rotation component as the last element in the quaternion. Q4 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The right ascension of the orbital position expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The orbital right ascension of the ascending node expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<RAAN<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The orbital radius of apoapsisexpressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field. The radius of apoapsis is the maximum distance (osculating) between the spacecraft and celestial body at the origin of CoordinateSystem.

The orbital radius of periapsis expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field. The radius of periapsis is the minimum distance (osculating) between the spacecraft and celestial body at the origin of CoordinateSystem.
The right ascension of orbital velocity expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The magnitude of the orbital position vector expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The orbital semi-major axis expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: SMA < -0.001 m or SMA > 0.001 meter. If SMA < 0, then ECC must be > 1

entry.para: The area used to compute acceleration due to solar radiation pressure.
The orbital true anomaly expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<TA<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The magnitude of the orbital velocity vector expressed in the coordinate system chosen in the CoordinateSystem field.
The x-component of the spacecraft velocity with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<Y<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The y-component of the spacecraft velocity with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<Y<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The z-component of the spacecraft velocity with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<Y<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The x-component of the spacecraft position with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<X<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The y-component of the spacecraft position with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The z-component of the spacecraft position with respect to the coordinate system chosen in the spacecraft's CoordinateSystem field.

listitem.para: -Inf<X<Inf where Inf is defined by compiler's definition of a real.

entry.para: The attitude mode for the spacecraft.
The attitude representation to display in the GUI and script file. AttitudeDisplayType is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The attitude rate representation to display in the GUI and script file. AttitudeRateDisplayType is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.

The orbital state type displayed in the GUI. Allowed state types are dependent upon the selection of CoordinateSystem. For example, if the coordinate system does not have a celestial body at the origin, Keplerian, ModifiedKeplerian, and Equinoctial are not allowed options for StateType.
The spacecraft orbit epoch in the A.1 system and the Modified Julian format.
[Deprecated] The current epoch in the A1ModJulian format.
The time and date corresponding to the specified orbit state. It defines the start time for propagation using the Propagate command.
The spacecraft orbit epoch in the A.1 system and the Modified Julian format.
The CoordinateSystem used in attitude computations. CoordinateSystem field is only used for the following attitude models: CoordinateSystemFixed.

The coordinate system with respect to which the orbital state is defined. The CoordinateSystem field is dependent upon the StateType field. If the coordinate system chosen by the user does not have a gravitational body at the origin, then the state types Keplerian, ModifiedKeplerian, and Equinoctial are not permitted.
The x-component of spacecraft body angular velocity expressed in the inertial frame. AngularVelocityX is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The y-component of spacecraft body angular velocity expressed in the inertial frame. AngularVelocityY is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The z-component of spacecraft body angular velocity expressed in the inertial frame. AngularVelocityZ is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The EulerAngleSequence used for EulerAngle input and output..
The value of the first modified Rodrigues parameter. MRP1 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The value of the second modified Rodrigues parameter. MRP2 is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.
The spacecraft Id used in SPICE kernels.
The spacecraft Id used in SPICE kernels.
The id of the spacecraft body frame used in SPICE kernels.
The spacecraft Id used in tracking data files. This field is only used for EstimationPlugin protype functionality.
SPK Kernels for spacecraft body frame. SPK Frame kernels have extension ".TF".

listitem.para: No Default. The field is emtpy.

entry.para: SPK Kernels for spacecraft clock. SPK clock kernels have extension ".TSC".

listitem.para: No Default. The field is emtpy.

entry.para: SPK Kernels for spacecraft attitude. SPK atttitude kernels have extension ".BC".

listitem.para: No Default. The field is emtpy.

entry.para: SPK Kernels for spacecraft orbit. SPK orbit kernels have extension ".BSP".

listitem.para: No Default. The field is emtpy.

entry.para: The quaternion vector. GMATs quaternion representation includes the three vector components as the first three elements in the quaternion and the rotation component as the last element in the quaternion. Quaternion is used for the following Attitude models: Spinner.

refsection.title: GUI
refsection.para: The GUI interface for ballistic and mass properties is contained on the Ballistic/Mass tab of the spacecraft resource. You can enter physical properties such as the drag and SRP areas and coefficients and the spacecraft dry mass which are used in orbital dynamics modelling.

refsection.title: Configuring Ballistic and Mass Properties
refsection.para: GMAT uses a cannonball model for drag and SRP. In the cannonball model, the area is assumed to be independent of the spacecrafts orientation with respect to the local velocity vector and the sun vector. For more details on the computation and configuration of drag and SRP models see the Dynamics Models documentation (include hyperlink in user docs).

refsection.title: Total Mass Computation
refsection.para: The TotalMass property of a spacecraft is a read-only property that is the sum of the DryMass value and the sum of the fuel mass in all attached fuel tanks. GMATs propagators will not allow the total mass of a spacecraft to be negative. However, GMAT will allow the mass of a FuelTank to be negative. See the FuelTank documentation for details.
